CatDescriptText: Mr. Raymond Qualey, newsstand salesman, North Side and Mr. Harry Smith, student, Carnegie, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 31, 1962, pg. A3   with question: "Should relief payments to unemployed persons be increased?" Mr. Qualey's answer reads: "I don't think so.  They're already getting enough."  Mr. Smith's answer reads: "Yes, I know it's bad when mine says that you're just able to barely exist on what you get."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Raymond Qualey wearing plaid cap and button down leather jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Harry Smith wearing flecked varsity style jacket and eyeglasses, standing with hands in pockets in front of flecked granite wall, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
